Title: Finance Manager
Job Description:
Job Title: Finance & Insurance Manager
Reports to: Operations Director

Position Description: The Finance & Insurance Manager is responsible for producing additional revenue for the facility by selling finance and insurance products to new and used vehicle customers. Must comply with information security program. Must present a professional appearance.

Duties & Responsibilities:

Establish and maintain positive working relationships with all sources of finance and insurance products, factory and otherwise.
Submit proper documentation to obtain approval for all possible finance transactions.
Work with sales management to establish and maintain a program that will ensure a 100-percent turnover to the Finance & Insurance department.
Work with Sales Managers to secure a reasonable profit from each transaction.
Establish forecast for finance department in conjunction with sales department to achieve a desired percent of penetration and income.
Verify the accuracy of all title, lien information, taxes, and other documents on customer paperwork.
Ensure accuracy of customer information in dealership data bases (including e-mail addresses).
Notarize deal paperwork as required.
Forward completed deals to office in a timely manner.
Acquire licenses for selling insurance, if applicable.
Prepare monthly reports on finance penetration and products sold.
Keep sales management up to date with regard to rates and products.
Complete all training certifications as directed by management.
Follow policies and procedures as set forth in the Personnel Policy Manual and other corporate policies.
Any other duties as assigned.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:

Educational: High school diploma or the equivalent.

Experience: Minimum two years in automotive sales experience.

Special Skills (i.e., licenses, certifications): Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to read and comprehend instructions and information. Ability to use personal computer applications including word processing and spreadsheet software. Current valid driver’s license and state sales license. Must be a Notary. Obtain AFIP certification within time frame established by management.

Physical Demands and Working Conditions:

The noise level in the work environment is occasionally loud. Occasionally requires the ability to lift 20 pounds of material. Is potentially exposed to battery acid, gasoline, chemical cleaning materials or other toxic materials commonly found in a motor vehicle dealership. Occasionally, exposed to exhaust fumes or other airborne particles.

Job Type:
Full-time
Pay: $120,000-$200,000 per year

Title: Investment Banking Analyst
Job Description:
Investment Banking Analyst

About Class VI Partners
Class VI Partners, LLC ("Class VI"), a member of FINRA, provides middle-market investment banking services, including business valuation, corporate advisory, mergers and acquisitions advisory, and private capital raising services. The firm is committed to ensuring that the lack of capital never impedes the dreams and aspirations of business owners.
If your ideal career involves purpose-driven work with meaningful upside in an organization that has well above industry average job satisfaction, a caring team, and very happy clients, you might thrive growing with us as an Analyst.

Employment Terms and Compensation
Target all-in compensation of $85K - $130K, including base salary and target bonus. Generous benefits package offered.
Bonus compensation is tied to both overall firm performance (financial metrics, i.e., revenue target) and individual performance. In each of the last three years, the firm has hit its revenue target and paid out full target bonus amounts.
We are an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate against otherwise qualified applicants on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, disability or handicap, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

Candidate Profile: Investment Banking Analyst
Candidates considered for this role will be highly motivated self-starters who possess financial modeling skills, strong oral and written communication abilities, demonstrated time management skills, and the desire to work on a team. This role is designed for the summer of 2023, but there is flexibility in timing.
The ideal candidate holds a relevant degree with a good academic track record (3.5 GPA or higher) and has proficiency in financial modeling, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft PowerPoint, and demonstrated an interest in mergers and acquisitions. FINRA Series 79 license is a plus. Authorization to work anywhere in the U.S. is required.

The Analyst responsibilities at Class VI provide significant opportunities for individual growth and development. Class VI is a small firm, and each team member will be called upon to perform multiple functions in addition to his or her stated responsibilities. As such, the Analyst role is critical to a successful transaction process.
Analyst Job Responsibilities:
Conducting financial modeling and valuation, creating pitch books, reports, presentations, and developing other materials essential to a successful deal
Honing your client management skills by attending client meetings and serving as the lead point of contact for our client CFOs’ analysis/financial requests
Assisting with all aspects of the deal process, including managing timelines and third parties, due diligence and data room management, and creation of research-based bidder list development and initial outreach
Contributing to innovation and improvement of internal processes and procedures
Developing your leadership skills by training new Analysts and conducting peer review of their work
Other duties as assigned In addition, it is expected that the Analyst will perform in a manner consistent with the Class VI value system, core competencies, and performance objectives established below.
The values to which each Class VI team member must adhere include:
Hustle / Humility / Relationships
Honesty / Integrity
Customer Excellence
Teamwork
Personal Accountability
Continuous Team and Individual Improvement
Fairness and Transparency
Hard Work & Balance

Title: Vice President, Investment Banking- Technology
Job Description:
Business Unit:
Corporate Finance
Industry:
TECH - Technology
Overview
Houlihan Lokey (NYSE:HLI) is a global investment bank with expertise in mergers and acquisitions, capital markets, financial restructuring, and valuation. The firm serves corporations, institutions, and governments worldwide with offices in the United States, Europe, the Middle East, and the Asia-Pacific region. Independent advice and intellectual rigor are hallmarks of the firm’s commitment to client success across its advisory services.
Houlihan Lokey is the No. 1 M&A advisor for the past six consecutive years in the U.S., the No. 1 global restructuring advisor for the past seven consecutive years, and the No. 1 global M&A fairness opinion advisor over the past 20 years, all based on number of transactions and according to data provided by Refinitiv.
Corporate Finance
The Houlihan Lokey Corporate Finance business has extensive expertise in mergers, acquisitions, divestitures, activist shareholder and takeover defense, and other related advisory services for a broad range of clients. In addition, we have the proven ability to engineer and execute financing solutions that are essential for growth and success and offer access to financing in the public and alternative capital markets through the issuance of debt, equity, or hybrid securities.
Houlihan Lokey is the No. 1 most active global M&A advisor, the No. 1 most active advisor to private equity globally, the most active technology advisor in the world as well as a global leader in industrials, business services, consumer, food, and retail, healthcare, and financial services M&A (according to data provided by Mergermarket and Pitchbook).
As trusted advisors, our industry-specific investment banking groups provide us with a deep understanding of our client’s business and positioning before we are even engaged in a transaction. Combined with this market penetration is our international presence throughout Europe, the United States, and the Asia-Pacific region.
Technology Group
Our Technology Group is a global team and recognized leader in providing high-quality, relationship-based advice to clients whose businesses offer data and analytics solutions. We have an extensive track record of working with both domestic and international clients and delivering creative, effective, and successful outcomes based on our deep understanding of our clients, their business models, and the markets in which they operate.
The environment at Houlihan Lokey is both collegial and entrepreneurial. Teamwork is essential to the firm’s success. At the same time, creativity and new ideas are encouraged. Associates are given substantial responsibility and are encouraged to help us grow our business. Associates work on transactions that provide exposure to various investment banking services, including M&A, private placements of debt and equity, refinancings, and leveraged buyouts.
Responsibilities
Prepare, analyze, and help explain historical and projected financial information
Coordinate and perform business due diligence and execute M&A transactions
Prepare confidential information memoranda, management presentations, marketing pitches, and other presentations
Value companies and businesses
Assist in the marketing and planning of engagements
Build relationships and maintain direct contact with clients, prospective clients, and professional advisors
Qualifications
The ideal candidate should have prior experience or a demonstrated interest in mergers and acquisitions, a strong work ethic, and the ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment. The environment at Houlihan Lokey is both collegial and entrepreneurial. Teamwork is essential to the firm’s success. At the same time, creativity and new ideas are encouraged.
Vice Presidents are given substantial responsibility and are encouraged to help us grow our business. The ideal candidate should be motivated, creative, outgoing, and possess strong skills in financial analysis. Candidates must have a strong knowledge of accounting and applied financial theory, keen analytical capabilities, and excellent verbal and written communication skills. At least four years of postgraduate investment banking experience is required. Coursework in accounting and finance and previous experience in Technology are highly recommended.
Salary Range
Houlihan Lokey is committed to providing its employees with an exciting career opportunity and competitive total compensation package, which may include other components such as discretionary incentive compensation. The firm’s good faith and reasonable estimate of the possible salary range for this role at the time of posting is:
$250,000.00
Actual salary at the time of hire may vary and may be above or below the range based on various factors, including, but not limited to, the candidate’s relevant qualifications, skills, and experience and the location where this position may be filled.
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Compliance Monitoring & Testing Associate
Job Description:
Overview:
Client is seeking an Associate for its Monitoring & Testing ( "M&T) department who will work to execute the M&T program.
This position will principally serve as a team member for M&T reviews and will have coverage for Client's Manufacturers Bank Digital Bank activities. Manufacturers Bank is a middle market commercial bank with an announced expansion into consumer banking, including deposit and lending products.
The compliance officer must have a background in banking operations and be knowledgeable of bank products and services to assess the impact that changes in laws or regulations have on the testing and monitoring program.
Requires strong practical knowledge of banking regulations including but not limited to ECOA, Truth in Lending, Truth in Savings, Electronic Fund Transfers, Fair Lending, Fair Credit Reporting Act, Regulation O, UDAAP and Privacy.
Additionally, a familiarity of the U.S. regulatory environment, risk identification/mitigation, and managing the workflows for monitoring and testing engagements is essential.
Responsibilities:
Assists the examiner-in-charge of Compliance Testing engagements.
Supports the development and refinement of monitoring and testing scripts.
Assists in development of information requests and announcement memorandums.
Supports the development and performance of field work to validate the efficacy of internal controls.
Prepares cohesive work papers for each engagement in accordance with department standards.
Identifies underlying issues and escalation/validation thereof with stakeholders.
Assists in the drafting of Issue Memorandums and Reports for issuance to management.
Helps in the registration and tracking of identified issues and corrective action plans.
Participates in remediation of issues and findings identified during the Compliance Reviews.
Stays abreast of changing regulatory requirements and client's business model to maintain a solid foundation of the applicable regulatory framework.
Assists in the consolidation and reporting of results within local and Head Office reporting.
Qualifications:
4+ years of retail banking experience.
Someone who is familiar with Bank Regulatory, Swap Dealer, or Broker-Dealer
Has a Compliance Testing, OCC/FRB/FDIC examiner or Internal Audit background.
Able to work independently on projects with little oversight.
Able to learn quickly and dissect complicated issues within a large and complex financial institution.
Solid knowledge of U.S. laws, rules, and regulations pertaining to retail banking.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Able to multi-task and perform work functions efficiently and timely.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is required.
Job Type: Full-time
Salary: $120,000.00 per year
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Ability to commute/relocate:
New York, NY 10172: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Application Question(s):
Are you willing to work hybrid in NYC?
Can you briefly explain your experience with Monitoring and Testing?
Experience:
Monitoring & Testing: 7 years (Required)
Digital/Retail Banking: 7 years (Required)
Swap Dealer, Broker Dealer, Bank Regulatory: 5 years (Required)
Compliance Testing: 7 years (Required)
OCC/FRB/FDIC examiner or Internal Audit background: 5 years (Preferred)
Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10172

Title: Experienced Automotive Sales Manager with F&I background

Title: Financial/Quantitative Analyst I - Mortgage Servicing Rights
Job Description:
Jenks, OK: Exciting new opening within Gateway First Bank! The Mortgage Servicing Rights Analyst I is a type of Financial/Quantitative Analyst that will focus on the SERVCO MSR reporting suite. No mortgage exp required. We are eager to teach a recent Finance or STEM graduate that has advanced Excel skills and has been exposed to R or another statistical programming language such as Python or VBA. This person will begin by maintaining current reports and models that have already been created, but as their technical skills improve and MSR knowledge expands they will be given an opportunity to develop models and automate where needed! The end goal of these reports and models is to effectively and accurately communicate the current state of the MSR portfolio to upper management. Apply today - we look forward to meeting you!
Mortgage Servicing Rights Analyst I JOB SUMMARY:
The Mortgage Servicing Rights Analyst I is responsible for the Servco MSR reporting suite, including developing and maintaining analyses and reports on portfolio pricing, delinquency, prepay speeds, recapture rates, roll rates, and more. This role will serve as resource for the current state of Servco's investment portfolio, including projections for financial returns and performance metrics. Works closely with management to provide insight on monthly changes in the portfolio. Also works with the subservicer and maintains oversight reporting and accounting entries.
Mortgage Servicing Rights Analyst I ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS (RESPONSIBILITIES):
Performs monthly updates of the MSR Performance Review including statistical program maintenance, financial sensibility checks, and an understanding of servicing functions and fixed-income mathematics.
Maintains accurate, organized, and current documentation of models and report assumptions including effective communication of complex formulas, ability to defend reasoning with evidence.
Conducts financial analysis of past cash flows to calculate and continually update Servco's internal rate of return, return on assets and return on equity.
Assists in developing financial models including ability to hold several aspects of a modeled scenario in memory and analyze how different variables would interact.
Participates in monthly portfolio valuations and works with third-party valuation vendors must be able to understand and analyze various aspects of MSR cash flows and calculate net present value.
Produces weekly briefings on changes in various aspects of the MSR portfolio along with ability to analyze and explain differences and offer ideas on possible causes.
Assists in meeting reporting requirements of regulators and counterparties along with the ability to interpret language in financial covenants and transpose into financial formulas to evaluate and report on Servco's financial status in relation to those covenants and where it might be in the near future.
Maintains updated reporting on each aspect of portfolio dynamics, including borrower payment behavior, default, prepayment, asset amortization, recapture, etc. must be able to understand and analyze all aspects of portfolio performance, as well as communicate effectively about portfolio dynamics with colleagues across all disciplines.
Acts as a subject matter expert on the state of the MSR portfolio and the servicing databases (must be able to confidently field questions from management about various aspects of the MSR portfolio).
Works with subservicer on monthly reconciliations and monthly true-ups on MSR flow deals as well as provides technical support to fund operations with regard to subservicer oversight, regulatory reporting, and MSR transaction management.
Exercises awareness with regard to possible suspicious activity, money laundering or fraudulent behavior and reports any such incidents to the BSA department. Performs all job functions in compliance with all company policies and federal, state, and local laws and regulations as applicable to the position, including, but not limited to BSA/AML, OFAC and GLBA/privacy rules.
Performs related responsibilities as required or assigned.
Requirements:
Mortgage Servicing Rights Analyst I REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Basic knowledge of fixed-income finance, with an emphasis in interest-only bond cash flows.
Strong data analytics skillset, including data mining, querying, automation, and visualization.
Proficient in MS Office applications.
Strong mathematical and statistical aptitude.
Ability to think critically to solve problems and work consistently with limited oversight.
Ability to maintain confidentiality.
Ability to work in a team environment and adapt to changing priorities.
Exemplifies the Gateway Values: Stay Growth Oriented, Make a Difference, "Get it Done" Attitude, Be a Team Player, Do the Right Thing
Equivalent Education/Experience
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or some related technical field.
0-2 years of experience with financial analysis and reporting and data visualizations.
Previous experience managing projects and sticking to predetermined timelines
Mortgage Servicing Rights Analyst I SPECIAL JOB DIMENSIONS:
Maintain strict department confidentiality standards. Up to 5% of travel may be required.
NOTE: The essential job functions and associated qualifications contained in this document describe the general nature and level of the work performed. They are not intended to represent an exhaustive listing or be inclusive of all aspects of the job. The tasks and procedures involved in the performance of the essential job functions may vary from day-to-day. Major changes in areas of responsibility may occur, as directed by management, and will require revision of this job description.

Title: Vice President/Senior Specialist - Collateral Management
Job Description:
Description
The Global Markets Operations function within Commercial Operations supports Middle and Back Office functions across a range of Listed and Over-The-Counter (’OTC’) derivative products. This role will work closely with partners in various Trading, Credit and Risk, Technology, Finance and Legal functions on a daily basis. In addition, this role will liaise with key external parties (Custodian Banks, FCMs, Brokers) to ensure calls are met timely, disputes are escalated and resolved, and trades are reconciled daily.
Responsibilities:
This position reports into the Collateral Management Manager within Global Markets Operations and will have responsibility for various daily collateral related activities including, but not limited to:
Margin (IM and VM) processing
Dispute resolution
Creation and dissemination of various daily, weekly, and monthly Collateral related reports
Moderate to high level of direct daily interaction with custodian (BoNY), Futures Commission Merchants, and executing broker/dealers.
Production and distribution of key collateral metrics and MI to senior management and relevant committees
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with key constituents
Proactively identify process enhancement opportunities to effectively mitigate risk and create scale
Primary functions include:
Processing of daily activities related to Derivative Collateral Management including:
Daily Initial and Variation margin calculation
Wire processing in support of call activity
Dispute management and escalation
Maintain key reference data (Master Agreements terms and conditions) within core applications
Support across collateral impacting businesses (Treasury, Global Markets, etc.) for new products and initiatives
Continuous assessment of technology to ensure an efficient, effective, scalable, and well controlled workflow model
Ongoing critical analysis of workflow to identify opportunities for operational efficiency through automation, risk appetite recalibration, and process re-design
Ensuring policies and procedures are current, effective, and well documented
Enhancing the effectiveness of existing internal controls
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree
5+ years of collateral management experience required
Prior experience at an FCM/CCP in Cleared Collateral preferred
Prior experience operating within Calypso’s Collateral Module a plus
Ability to work effectively independently, as well as collaborate well within a small team.
Strong working knowledge of industry standard derivative agreements (ISDAs, MSFTAs, CSAs, etc.) and terms contained within
Experience with key industry technology supporting Portfolio Reconciliation (TriOptima), Margin Call Messaging (AcadiaSoft) and Clearinghouses (CME, LCH, ICE) preferred
Demonstrable understanding of industry regulation and subsequent impact to Collateral and constituent businesses
Working knowledge of Visual Basic for Applications (VBA), Microsoft Access database creation and maintenance, advanced Microsoft Excel (Macros & V-Lookups) a plus
Passionate about Continuous Improvement (CI) and experience with Business Intelligence (BI) tools (Alteryx, Tableau, etc.) a plus
Strong written and verbal communication and interpersonal skills
Working knowledge of typical treasury products
Understanding of accounting principles and practice
Ability to prioritize, perform and coordinate tasks in a fast-paced environment
May be required to work extended hours when necessary
Hours and Work Schedule
Hours per Week: 40+
Work Schedule: M-F, 8am to 5pm

Title: Specialized Banker-Heartland Specialized Industries
Job Description:
HTLF is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors.
HTLF is a diversified financial services company headquartered in Dubuque, Iowa. We deliver community banking at scale by powering our geographically diverse group of banks with technology, efficiency and strength — giving local decision-making the opportunity and insights to focus on customers and growth. Relationships have been the core of our company since its founding in 1981. We're deeply invested in the communities we serve, and that's why our clients choose us as their banking partners.
What's different about a career at HTLF? We believe our employees and their diverse backgrounds, perspectives and skills are our greatest assets. We wouldn't be HTLF without the people with whom we surround ourselves and empower to enrich the lives of our customers, employees and communities. We're dedicated to making HTLF the best place to work – where your opinions are valued, your feedback and ideas are heard, and your opportunities for personal growth and professional development are endless.
Specialty Industries Banker III is responsible for the sales, service, and retention of complex and profitable companies within specialized industries. This position is responsible for new business development, portfolio management, credit quality, and overall relationship management of an assigned portfolio of commercial customers. This position works independently to manage and develop complex commercial accounts across the national footprint of HTLF.

Primary Responsibilities
Acts as primary contact for new business development which focuses on the acquisition of complex and profitable Specialty companies across a broad geographic footprint.
Prospects within defined objectives and verticals, referring to the Member Banks when opportunities fit outside the parameters of the role.
Sources prospects and COI's.
Cross sells all bank products; directs the coordination of product partners in the attainment of business plans.
Advises clients and prospects of the Member Banks to appropriately handle the clients needs while making sure the relationship manager at the Member Bank level is actively engaged in support of these clients.
Owns or designates primary point of contact to ensure an excellent customer relationship.
Individual budget responsibility in alignment with Incentive Plan Goals.
Works in collaboration with credit professionals to produce written support of new or renewing credit exposure.
Works with compliance, credit review, and auditors to ensure credit extension is within policy and applicable laws and regulation.
Supports executive level initiatives as they arise; ensuring consistent messaging across all markets as it relates to new business strategies, credit policies, etc.
Represents HTLF in civic and community functions.
Monitors credit quality within assigned portfolios and takes action when necessary.
Identifies, evaluates, structures and documents commercial credit transactions.
Participates in joint calls with business partners to develop customers.
Drives revenue growth through self-sourced opportunities within the upper-end / more complex universe of commercial customers and prospects.
Completes annual E-Learning Plan and Bank Secrecy Act (BSA) training as assigned and keeps up-to-date knowledge of BSA as it relates to the job function.

Bachelor's Degree in Business, Management, Finance or a related field preferred
5+ years of experience managing commercial/corporate banking relationships
Demonstrated success of prospecting, sourcing new opportunities and business development
Strong knowledge of commercial banking products and services (both credit and non-credit)
Significant sales/client interfacing experience demonstrating respect and positive attitude
Proven consultative sales approach and track record of opening new markets/business development
Ability to assess and analyze financial conditions of a middle market relationship
Ability to work independently and leverage professional relationships within and outside multiple bank brands
Extensive knowledge of financial analysis, risk evaluation, loan documentation and commercial loan structures
Full utilization of sales automation tools and related technologies
Excellent sales presentation, interpersonal, negotiation and written and verbal communication skills, both internally and externally
Scheduled Weekly Hours:
40
Time Type:
Full time
The targeted salary for this role is:
$159,917.00
You may also be offered incentive compensation, and benefits. Compensation may vary and is based on geographic location of the specific role as well as the skills and experiences of the selected candidate.

Title: VP & Business Unit Financial Officer - Digital Banking
Job Description:
Join the Hartford Courant/Fox 61 Top Workplace for 9 Years in a Row - #1 in 2017 & 2019!

OVERALL OBJECTIVE

The Financial Planning & Analysis function provides business leaders and executive management insightful and actionable guidance that helps Liberty Bank achieve its Strategic Plan. Reporting to the FVP & LOB Finance Manager, this role is a vital step in the continued growth of the FP&A function at Liberty Bank.

This position will create, implement and manage the holistic financial and accounting support for the Digital Bank within Liberty Bank – in essence a “mini-CFO/Controller” for the Digital Bank. This position will be responsible for all FP&A and Accounting processes related to the Digital Bank – including monthly close process and reporting of business unit financial results, variance analysis, KPI/Operational & Financial metric development & analysis, ad-hoc analysis, annual Operating Budget and Forecast preparation, Strategic Plan, and tracking performance vs. Strategic Plan.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Consult with Digital Bank Leadership, identifying key insights, risks and opportunities
o Proactively provide recommendations for operating performance improvement

o Oversee and lead the preparation of Monthly Business Reviews (MBR’s) for the Digital Bank

Lead the monthly earnings cycle for the Digital Bank
o Analyze financial and non-financial monthly results, trends and operational metrics/KPI’s

o Partner with Digital Banking team to determine appropriate monthly accrual GL entries

o Prepare monthly reporting package for the Digital Bank including variance analysis vs. Budget, Forecast, and Strategic Plan

o Build profitability and operational models for Digital Bank, and create ad-hoc analysis to uncover deeper insights into Digital Bank performance

Lead the annual Operating Budget and Strategic Planning process for the Digital Bank
o In partnership with Digital Bank Leadership, develop key assumptions and prepare the driver based annual operating budget, as well as Strategic Plan

o Prepare pro-forma analysis and Forecast updates on a periodic basis

Actively lead and participate in Finance related special projects
MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance. Advanced degree or certification preferred
10 - 15 years Financial Management Reporting experience specifically within a bank, including leadership experience
Demonstrated experience in organizing and leading Finance processes, including monthly close, Annual Budget, Quarterly Forecasting and Strategic Planning processes
Deep understanding of Bank balance sheets, revenue drivers, and reporting methodologies including Funds Transfer Pricing (FTP), and business line cost allocations
Significant experience partnering with C-Suite Executives. A seasoned professional with poise and presence while interacting with Executives.
Relevant experience supporting Digital/Technology divisions strongly preferred
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Strategic thinking – demonstrated ability to provide insightful recommendations to C-Suite Executives
Highly organized and detail oriented.
Advanced data management skills. Comfortable mining, managing and reporting large sets of operational and financial data.
Expert Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word, and Access skills
Experience utilizing Management Reporting & Budgeting systems
PHYSICAL DEMANDS

Keyboard dexterity
General office equipment
Prolonged sitting
Operating a motor vehicle
COMPLIANCE

Adheres to applicable federal and state regulations and Bank policies and procedures, including OFAD, BSA, Patriot Act
Privacy, and consumer protection regulations pertaining to incumbent’s business line
Completes required training (on-line and in-person) by set due dates
LI-AM1
LI-HYBRID
In order to be considered an applicant, you must meet the minimum requirements of the position.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin, disability, protected veteran status.

Title: Senior Client Coverage Banker - Energy Transition
Job Description:
Rabobank Wholesale Banking North America is a premier corporate and investment bank to the food, agribusiness, commodities and renewable energy industries, providing sector expertise, strategic advisory and tailored financial solutions to our clients. We thrive on building long-term relationships with clients and stakeholders in the fastest-growing food and agribusiness region of the world.
Strategic objective of the division
Main objectives & growth strategy of the global business line
In line with Rabobank’s strategy to be a leading global bank for the Energy Transition with a sector knowledge advantage, Rabobank North America is expanding its team of specialized renewable energy bankers. In this regard, knowledge leadership in this sector, building new client relationships and client income maximization will be a primary focus and responsibility of the Senior Client Coverage Banker in achieving his/her commercial objectives. The Banker operates in a dynamic and demanding environment in which proactivity, flexibility and discipline is required across all areas, from pitching through structuring and execution, to follow up and monitoring. The ET line of business is a crucial new growth strategy for Rabobank North America and will offer the Banker the opportunity to play a leading role in building and evolving this growth business. The Banker is responsible for his/her own commercial objectives which are centered on revenue delivery, cost management and loss minimization. The regulatory framework is bound to local regulatory frameworks and Rabobank policies and procedures.
Mission statement: Rabobank is committed to support the energy transition globally. Job Profile X 11.22.2022 – Project Finance – MD, Energy Transition Senior Client Coverage Banker Rabobank has been a key player in the Dutch energy sector for many years across the entire spectrum of products and services. Internationally, we have supported the energy sector through, mainly, our strong position in PF. Rabobank North America’s ambition is to be a leading renewable energy financier and facilitator of industry transition to cleaner fuels for our clients. Rabobank has consistently been a frontrunner in renewable energy finance. PF has built a strong portfolio in this sector, demonstrating a distinctive advantage in terms of knowledge, commitment and experience. Rabobank is a leading global bank in this sector (Bloomberg #7 Global Ranking in Renewable Energy in 2021), financing annually >85 projects globally in the onshore wind, solar power, biomass energy storage and geothermal sector. Rabobank would like to maintain its leading position as this sector rapidly moves into new markets and new technologies. Working for the Rabobank Group demands special competences from the individual employee, who must have a natural tendency to collaborate with customers, other team members and colleagues. The added value manifests itself in permanent, mutual collaboration between all national and international business units and entities within the Rabobank Group. The permanent collaboration enables us to achieve shared professional results, where short-term and long-term customer interest is at the forefront. This requires employees to have a personality which is clearly "actively focused on other people" and for employees to make a careful consideration between risks and results in the performance of work duties with the objective to increase and maintain customer confidence in the entire value chain of product development, product distribution and customer advice. Employees within the Rabobank Group are aware of possible risks to the organization in performing their work duties and handle these risks with care. The Rabobank Group’s Code of Conduct forms the framework for how to do business within the entire Rabobank Group.
Objectives of the role
The main tasks and responsibilities of the Senior Client Coverage Banker (Banker) are to manage and develop client relationships with global and North America-based companies involved in the Energy Transition (ET) to lower-carbon fuel sources. More specifically, the Banker represents Rabobank to new and existing clients in this sector, and is fully responsible and accountable maximizing the revenues from these clients through successful origination, structuring and execution (as deal captain) of tailored transactions. The Banker will act as lead structuring/execution deal captain for corporate-related transactions for ET-related clients of the Project Finance business line (i.e., owners and operators of renewable energy and other ET-related assets) as well as develop new business with owners/operators and supply chain participants in the emerging ET sector (which may include manufacturers and service providers in the sector). This client base is expected to develop as Rabobank’s footprint in the ET sector grows and will initially be in the wind, solar, distributed energy, battery storage and waste-to-energy/renewable natural gas subsectors with future growth anticipated in hydrogen, e-mobility, carbon capture and other emerging subsectors. The Banker is furthermore responsible for risk monitoring and (if applicable) actively supporting the Bank’s Financial Restructuring Department in ongoing restructurings of his/her client portfolio and for maintaining an active dialogue with local and regional risk managers, and the Bank’s Risk Department in the US and the Netherlands. The Banker will manage a team of transaction specialists and coach more junior employees in the performance of their tasks and responsibilities.
The role allows the Banker, among other skills, to:
Further develop deep account management and business development/origination skills and experience;
Apply his/her existing deep knowledge and understanding of energy industry dynamics to maximize client franchise income for Corporate Clients;
Serve as a key facilitator of cooperation across product teams;
Be the deal captain in complex transaction execution;
(Pro)actively participate on ET sector platforms and in other internal and external networks;
Develop coaching and (project) management skills.
The key relationships for the Banker include: Product Specialists and Department Heads, Global and Regional Sector Heads, Debt Structuring Advisors, Risk Department (New York and Utrecht), Legal, Compliance, Rabobank Senior Management, RaboResearch Analysts, RaboAgrifinance, De Lage Landen (Rabobank’s leasing arm) and other banks. In Job Profile X 11.22.2022 – Project Finance – MD, Energy Transition Senior Client Coverage Banker addition, the Banker is expected to have strong existing relationships with key decision makers (CEO/CFO/Shareholders) of clients and prospects in the ET sector.
Autonomy
Origination: opportunity/idea generation; Initial analysis; opportunity/idea development/pitchbook production; pitching/presentations; Client Service Team representation;
Product Ownership: overall ownership of corporate lending within the North America Energy Transition strategy;
Structuring: deep financial analysis and financial modelling; scenario analysis; deal structuring (pricing, covenant setting, etc.); mandate documents negotiation; due diligence coordination;
Execution: internal approval generation; loan documents negotiation; signing/closing/post-closing coordination; syndication support; deal team management;
Management and mentorship: managing (junior) client coverage banker and credit analysts in origination and execution of transactions;
Monitoring: information processing/covenant checks; credit reviews and waiver requests;
Reporting line: Reports to the Regional Head PF Americas.
Key interfaces/relationships
From a Client Coverage perspective:
Origination: opportunity/idea generation; opportunity development/ pitchbook production; pitching/presentations
Networking: building and maintaining a network within Rabobank; building and maintaining a network among external advisors and banks; building and maintaining a network among leading players in Energy Transition asset development, construction and ownership and the related supply chain
Management: effectively represent Rabobank in developing and maintaining viable relationships with the desired customer base; financial reporting and portfolio revenue forecasting; operational risk management
Account Management: relationship account planning; Client Service Team coordination; prospecting; client networking; CRM data management; pipeline management
Execution: multi-product deal team coordination
Portfolio Management: exercising portfolio control; maintaining dialogue with credit risk analyst, senior risk officer and various credit departments; active portfolio management/financial resource planning
Regulatory framework
Comply with all US laws, rules and regulations, including without limitation, AML and OFAC/Sanctions requirements and the reporting of suspicious activity (and all Rabobank policies, procedures and guidelines), as well as the following Policies and Standards: - Anti-Bribery and Corruption Policy - Anti-Money Laundering Policy - Clean Desk Policy Job Profile X 11.22.2022 – Project Finance – MD, Energy Transition Senior Client Coverage Banker - Code of Conduct - Complaint and Whistleblower Protection Policy - Conflicts of Interest Policy - Gift and Entertainment Policy - Information Barrier and Confidentiality Policy - Know Your Customer Procedures - Media Policy - Outside Interest Policy (Including Outside Business Activities and Private Investments) - Personal Investment Policy - Required Absence from Sensitive Position Policy - Sanctions Policy - World Wide Compliance Standards - Employee Policy Manual
Key responsibilities
Originating, structuring and executing transactions, in the role of deal captain. The Banker is expected to achieve the projected core lending ET revenues, build a portfolio of ET corporate clients and play a leading role in supporting the cross sell targets. 40%
Relationship management: building and extending a relationship with large Global Sponsors in the Renewable Energy Sector. 30%
Developing and expanding thought leadership in the Renewable Energy Sector 15 Coaching and knowledge transfer to team members. 15%
Leadership: In case of (hierarchical) management responsibilities the following is applicable:
Give priority to the long-term interests of your customers and Rabobank.
Displaying adequate exemplary behavior and fulfilling an exemplary position concerning the propagation of core values and basic principles of focus on customers’ interests first (in Dutch ‘Klantbelang Centraal’).
Act responsibly with regard to identified risks and actively discuss these both within and outside the own domain.
Act within the defined risk appetite and be accountable for the extent to which we demonstrably manage risks through risk assessments, controls and mitigating actions.
Stimulate and assure a strong risk culture, awareness of risks and everyone’s contribution to risk management and protecting Rabobank’s reputation.
Ensuring the creation of a culture and circumstances in order to function properly as a unit; honesty and ethical standards and values in the control and treatment of employees; following the HR cycle, GROW! and creating a feedback culture.
Key performance indicators
Market / Customer Focus
Uses market insight to serve the customer in the best way possible
Strategic Vision
Draws up an effective action plan for the team
Inspirer
Engages the immediate environment to feel committed and accountable
Synergize across group
Demonstrates broad professional collaboration to add value
Challenge/Driver innovation
Spreads innovative ideas and experience
Output/ result driven
Achieves consistent (commercial) results together with others Job Profile X 11.22.2022 – Project Finance – MD, Energy Transition Senior Client Coverage Banker
Knowledge, experience and competencies Education / Work and attitude level
At least 15 years of Client Coverage/RM experience in the energy sector, including selling, originating and executing traditional lending products, as well as cross selling more complex corporate finance products
MBA or equivalent degree or equivalent work experience
Additional requirements and/or qualifications
Proven track record in wholesale banking
Proven track record in debt and credit structuring
Experience in relationship/account management
Experience in structuring and negotiating deals with clients
Experience in leading transactions
Experience of working with global and NA-based energy companies
Understanding of the dynamics in the energy industry
Deep and wide banking product knowledge
Drive for innovation and value creation
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills, including cross-team collaboration and teamwork
High energy, work ethic and desire for excellence
Other potential qualifications
CFA qualifications
Series 79/63
Formal credit training program completed
Leadership and skills:
The 4 dimensions of Rabo Leadership: Personal, Team, One Rabo and Community
Storytelling
Coaching
Judgement & decision making
Networking
We Offer:
With healthcare and insurance costs on the rise, Rabobank employees enjoy a first-class benefits package, featuring a selection of medical coverage and investment options to meet your personal needs. Our benefits program includes:
Medical
Dental
Vision
Health care spending account
Dependent care spending account
Basic life insurance plus AD&D insurance
Optional life insurance
Short-term disability
Long-term disability
401(k) program
Health and wellness seminars
Tuition reimbursement
Salary Expectations
Target Hiring Range:
$270,000 - $400,000
This position is subject to the terms of Rabobank’s compensation plans and policies. It is anticipated that the position will pay within the target hiring range. The range is reflective of the desired primary physical work location and may be adjusted outside of the projected range based on geographical differentiation if the actual work location of the hired candidate differs from the desired primary location, or for other lawful reasons. Further, the position includes all other benefits provided to Rabobank employees, including healthcare benefits, 401k matching, vacation, sick leave, parental leave, possible discretionary bonuses and all other benefits that are all governed by and subject to ERISA plan documents and eligibility.

Title: Unsecured Lending and Credit Cards Risk Manager I
Job Description:
399858BR
Risk Management
Wilmington, DE
February 15, 2023
Company Overview
About TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank®
TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank, is one of the 10 largest banks in the U.S., providing over 9.8 million customers with a full range of retail, small business and commercial banking products and services at more than 1,100 convenient locations throughout the Northeast, Mid-Atlantic, Metro D.C., the Carolinas and Florida. In addition, TD Auto Finance, a division of TD Bank, N.A., offers vehicle financing and dealer commercial services. TD Bank and its subsidiaries also offer customized private banking and wealth management services through TD Wealth®. TD Bank is headquartered in Cherry Hill, N.J. To learn more, visit www.td.com/us. Find TD Bank on Facebook at www.facebook.com/TDBank and on Twitter at www.twitter.com/TDBank_US and www.twitter.com/TDNews_US.
TD Bank, America’s Most Convenient Bank, is a member of TD Bank Group and a subsidiary of The Toronto-Dominion Bank of Toronto, Canada, a top 10 financial services company in North America. The Toronto-Dominion Bank trades on the New York and Toronto stock exchanges under the ticker symbol “TD”. To learn more, visit www.td.com.
We offer a competitive salary and benefit program, including: comprehensive, affordable health care through medical, dental, and vision coverage; financial security with life and disability insurance; opportunities to save using health savings and flexible spending accounts; retirement benefits to help prepare for the future; paid time off and work/life benefits to maintain a good balance.
Department Overview
Job Description Summary
The Risk Manager I manages the creation, implementation and validation of various risk segmentation strategies including, but not limited to: adjudication, account management, exposure management, risk segmentation, and financial return optimization. This job provides critical information, interpretative, and detailed analysis, and deploys critical credit risk rational strategies that ensure the decisions are made within the TD risk appetite and adhere to all governmental requirements and guidelines. The Risk Manager I’s primary accountability is providing a comprehensive and diverse range of risk management expertise. The Risk Manager I investigates, creates, implements and validates various risk segmentation strategies and policies using complex data, advanced analytical approach, and business intelligence tools.
Job Description
Demonstrates governance, control and risk management behaviors in alignment with TD policies and practices
Leads/participates in the identification, development and implementation of new initiatives, operating workflow, additional services/applications or operational efficiencies including potentially leading special project teams or cross functional work groups
Assists with developing and enhancing credit risk assessment capabilities to identify and maintain good business opportunities with new and existing clients
Performs detailed analysis and interprets information to make recommendations to Senior Management on critical strategies including non-standard and ad-hoc requests as determined by management
Creates reports on the results of implemented strategies, using all appropriate quantitative methods and MIS, and makes recommendations to increase efficiencies and revenue while managing credit risk and produce those reports on a regular basis
Effectively works cross-functionally with teams outside of risk
Works with Internal Audit / External Regulators, to ensure that documentation for all work processes is complete and up-to-date
Ensures sound credit control by taking a pro-active approach to risk management within the risk guidelines of the Bank
Ensures the timely communication of issues that are relevant to the team and encourages a good working relationship with other internal and external groups
Requirements
Must be eligible for employment under regulatory standards applicable to the position.
Bachelor’s degree required; Graduate degree preferred
5+ years’ experience required
Proficient PC skills including a strong competency in MS Excel and PowerPoint, and a variety of PC-based analytical and reporting software packages
Experience with the use of Relational Databases and the process of Extract Transform Load (ETL) using common languages such as SQL or SAS
Familiar with various analytical or reporting tools, such as SAS, R, Matlab Tableau, etc.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills are required to interpret data and draw conclusions
Experience in data modeling and risk management either from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Experienced in developing and presenting recommendations to Senior Management
Hours
40
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live in and serve, and creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
If you are a candidate with a disability and need an accommodation to complete the application process, email the TD Bank US Workplace Accommodations Program at USWAPTDO@td.com . Include your full name, best way to reach you, and the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process.
EOE/Minorities/Females/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

Title: Finance Manager
Job Description:
Position Overview:
The Finance Manager is responsible for managing one of the most important profit centers in the dealership. This position must sell supplemental finance and insurance programs to new and used car buyers, including financing the vehicle purchase managing one of the most important profit centers in any dealership. The Finance Manager has responsibilities to the dealership, as well as to the customer and must have a thorough understanding of all the job responsibilities to achieve success. The Finance Manager also works with financial lenders to give fair interest rates to buyers and programs. As with all positions within dealerships, Finance Managers are expected to uphold the highest ethical standards. This position must be abreast of federal, state and local regulations that affect their operations and oversees the front-end operations to ensure compliance with all local, state and federal regulations, lenders and vendor policies and procedures.

Responsibilities:
Offers vehicle financing and insurance to customers and providing them with a thorough explanations of aftermarket products and extended warranties and a complete explanation of manufacturer and dealership service procedures and policies is necessary.
Secures financing and establishes lender relations: Seeks new lending institutions and maintaining good working relationships to secure competitive interest rates and financing programs.
Processes financing and leasing deals accurately and securing approval through financial sources and through the proper federal, state and corporate channels.
Generates a profit while maintaining fiduciary responsibility to the company
Understands and complies with federal, state and local regulations that affect the new and used vehicle and finance departments.
Develops an ideal working relationship between the Sales and Finance departments that will ensure both production and profits are maximized and that all sales are reported to the Finance Department.
Develops and implements and Finance orientation program for newly hired sales staff, which provides information on finance and lease programs and the benefits of the dealership's financing and extended service programs.
Controls the funds: Keeps control of dealership financing until the loan is approved and all the necessary paperwork has been signed. On cash deals, the Finance manager maintains control until all of the money is accounted for, all checks are received, and funds have been verified or until a draft has been delivered and drafting instructions have been made available.
Completes the paperwork: The Finance Manager is responsible for all paperwork involved with the sale of the vehicle. This includes obtaining customer signatures on all necessary forms and obtaining payoff and insurance information.
Trains and motivates the sales department: The Finance Manager must train and educate the sales staff regarding the inner workings of the finance department, the benefits of the protective products offered, the role that salespeople play and their overall impact on maintaining a successful program and maximizing department income.
Monitors performance and provides daily progress reports to the Dealer and General Manager. End of month summary reports are also required.

Qualifications:
A minimum of two years in automotive sales
A minimum of one year in a managerial role
High School Diploma or equivalent is required
A college degree or equivalent experience in finance is preferred
Strong background in business, mathematics, marketing and computer technology
All Finance personnel must maintain the highest ethical standards
The ability to work under pressure and handle stress.

About Bayou Automotive
Bayou Automotive has a strong moral compass and treats all of its associates with respect. The success of our employees is paramount. We provide extensive training and mentoring to help guide all employees to a successful career. We have a competitive compensation plan and benefit package.

Title: Commercial Banker
Job Description:
Robinson & Co
Robinson & Co
Robinson & Co Banking arranges financing for businesses across almost every industry, including startups. Our team of bankers are adept at structuring diverse financing solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of our clients. Our core business model is brokering and negotiating financing for companies and real estate investors.
Robinson & Co is a growing investment bank looking to expand with the onboarding of ten bankers for the 2023 year. We are seeking individuals who possess the desire to work remotely, using tools and support provided by Robinson & Co. Robinson & Co has high standards, strong team culture, and a commitment to personal development. To this end, books and podcasts are encouraged to be shared among team members. Whether it works out with the company would be separate from the overall goal of encouraging the enrichment of individuals - making you a better person than you were before joining the company. Outside of monies earned from dealmaking, discretionary annual bonuses will be paid out to everyone in the firm based on performance. Commercial Bankers make 30-50% commission earned on all deals closed.
This is NOT an employment offer but full commission, nonsalaried with no caps on your income.
Title: Commercial Banker
Reports to: VP of Markets
Compensation: Commission Only
Overview:
As a commercial banker at our loan brokering investment bank, you will be responsible for sourcing and securing finance for clients. You will work with clients to assess their financial needs and goals, and use your expertise and relationships with lenders to secure the most favorable financing terms for them. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying and targeting potential clients, as well as building and maintaining relationships with existing clients. You will also be responsible for analyzing market trends and identifying new opportunities for the company to pursue.
Key Responsibilities:
Identify and target potential clients who could benefit from the company's finance brokering services. This may involve conducting market research, analyzing data, and building relationships with potential clients.
Sourcing finance for clients and working with them to determine the most appropriate financing options for their needs. This may include reviewing financial statements, preparing loan packages, and negotiating terms with lenders.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients, including conducting regular client meetings and presentations. You will be the primary point of contact for clients and will be responsible for ensuring that their needs are met and their expectations are exceeded.
Analyzing market trends and identifying new opportunities for the company to pursue. You will be expected to keep abreast of industry developments and to identify potential growth areas for the company.
Participating in business development activities, including networking events and industry conferences. You will be expected to actively seek out new business opportunities and to represent the company in a professional manner.
Collaborating with other departments within the company, including the underwriting and closing teams, to ensure a smooth and efficient loan process for clients. You will be expected to work closely with these teams to ensure that deals are closed in a timely manner.
Requirements:
Strong analytical skills and ability to assess financial risks and opportunities. You should be comfortable working with financial data and be able to identify key trends and patterns.
Excellent communication and presentation skills. You should be able to clearly and effectively communicate complex financial concepts to clients and stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team. You should be able to take ownership of your work and be able to work effectively with others to achieve common goals.
Strong business development skills and ability to build and maintain relationships with clients. You should be able to identify and pursue new business opportunities and be able to build and maintain strong relationships with clients.
Experience working with a variety of financing products, including term loans, revolving credit facilities, and structured finance.
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced commercial banker to join our team. If you are passionate about finance and have a track record of success in the industry, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity. This is a commission only position with potential for unlimited earning potential.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of clients and to make a significant impact on the growth and success of the company. If you are driven, ambitious, and have a track record of success in the finance industry, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity.
Job Type: Contract
Pay: $90,000.00 - $250,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Physical setting:
Office
Schedule:
10 hour shift
Supplemental pay types:
Commission pay
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Bellevue, WA 98005

Strive to achieve an outstanding level of customer service in accordance with Bank’s standards and competencies.

Essential Functions:
This role will be primarily focused on Project Finance transactions. Provide a broad suite of services and financing arrangements with financing needs typically $10 million or above. Expertise with complex financing transactions across sectors including power, energy, and infrastructure.
Provide a broad suite of services and financing arrangements to large and middle market corporations with financing needs typically $10 million or above. Expertise with complex financing transactions for mergers and acquisitions, recapitalizations, loan syndications, project finance and specialized industry lending (including non-leveraged and/or leveraged loans).
Responsible for marketing, sales and developing business relationships with current and potential clients. Should be comfortable meeting with top management of client companies, Agent banks, and bank committee members.
Responsible to source, review and present for approval new transactions and annual reviews (via Credit Approval Memorandums) for all business relationships under management to the Credit Committee or other appropriate lending authority level.
Working with credit analysts to underwrite and analyze loans by evaluating and reviewing loan information, including but not limited to financial projections, risk mitigation, financial statements, financial models, lender presentations/decks, public filings, datarooms, diligence reports, appraisal reports, and other related loan information and supporting documentation.
Ability to present to credit committee in a credible manner, anticipate potential questions in advance, and respond to related requests accurately and efficiently.
Work with the Corporate Banking Head in the development and implementation of the strategies of corporate banking activities, including providing support on the structuring of complex financing transactions and loan syndications.
Maintain a sound operating environment including the establishment of a balanced risk management approach and adherence to applicable policies and regulatory requirements.
Provide leadership to ensure that staff has the required competencies to assess the value of businesses, structure financing proposals and market the Bank’s products and services.
Monitor the implementation and achievement of tactical initiatives and adherence to financial plan (budget), including P&L responsibility.
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Business Administration or related field.
Master’s degree in Finance/Business Administration or related field preferred.
7-10 years’ experience in a similar job

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITTY EMPLOYER

Title: Finance Manager
Job Description:
Overview:
The Finance Manager coordinates all activities regarding finance and insurance for our valued customers, which includes working to help customers obtain financing, preparing all associated documentation, and selling extended service contracts and additional protection products. He or she ensures all deals are done in a timely manner and according to all legal requirements and dealership policies. The Finance Manager will be responsible for preparing and ensuring the accuracy of legal documents, selling products and services to new and used vehicle customers, and enhancing the customer experience while achieving maximum profitability.

The ideal candidate has a degree in Finance or a related field and two or more years of finance and insurance experience. He or she has a positive attitude, a confident and outgoing personality, a professional appearance, strong business acumen and sales aptitude, great communication skills, and the ability to deliver world class customer service.

In addition to competitive pay, we offer our employees: Health, Dental, Vision, Life, 401K, Health &Wellness Program, community involvement and company paid vacation and holidays.
Responsibilities:
Offers vehicle financing and insurance to customers and provides them with a thorough explanation of aftermarket products and extended warranties and a complete explanation of manufacturer and dealership service procedures and policies.
Works with customers to obtain financing through lenders on vehicle purchases in conformance with state and federal law.
Prepares all state and federal documents regarding vehicle purchases in a timely manner and in accordance with established laws and procedures.
Maintains good working relationships with lending institutions to secure competitive interest rates and financing programs.
Works with the Sales team to ensure all new sales are referred to the F&I department and that the Sales team has information on finance and lease programs and understands the benefits of the dealership’s financing and extended service programs.
Ensures 100% compliance with all state and federal laws and regulations.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Greeting client to effectively time transition from Sales to Finance.
Determines client's financing needs based on a professional interview process.
Educates client the value of these options and products and assist them to make the wisest and best decision.
Processing finance transaction including lenders approval and timely funding.
Ensures that all administrative processes are handled timely and in compliance with company policy.
Ensuring clients satisfaction on every transaction and address it immediately if needed. Providing an exceptional client experience.
Achieving targeted Sales and Finance departments' goals. Finance manager performance is measured by achieving targeted Client Satisfaction Index and Targeted Sales and Finance goals.
Follow all company policies and procedures.
Demonstrates behaviors consistent with the Company's Values in all interactions with customers, co-workers and vendors.

Qualifications:
2 + years automotive finance experience preferred or 5-8 years related finance experience. We are willing to train the right candidate.
Prior sales experience preferred but not required.
Experience in Advent and ADP is preferred.
Professional appearance and work ethic.
Self-Starter and Self-Motivator.
Excellent communication, customer service, and problem-solving skills, including the ability to maintain composure under stress.
Excellent interpersonal skills to interact professionally with customers, vendors, and staff.
Strong organization skills, able to multi-task, and can manage time to meet frequently changing deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
Strong math skills.
Strong computer and internet skills, including Microsoft Office suite.
Excellent Verbal/Written communication skills, and Customer Satisfaction Skills.
Toyota experience a PLUS!
Bilingual a PLUS!
GREAT opportunity for a recently graduated college student!

Title: Commercial Banker
Job Description:
Robinson & Co
Robinson & Co
Robinson & Co Banking arranges financing for businesses across almost every industry, including startups. Our team of bankers are adept at structuring diverse financing solutions tailored to meet the specific needs of our clients. Our core business model is brokering and negotiating financing for companies and real estate investors.
Robinson & Co is a growing investment bank looking to expand with the onboarding of ten bankers for the 2023 year. We are seeking individuals who possess the desire to work remotely, using tools and support provided by Robinson & Co. Robinson & Co has high standards, strong team culture, and a commitment to personal development. To this end, books and podcasts are encouraged to be shared among team members. Whether it works out with the company would be separate from the overall goal of encouraging the enrichment of individuals - making you a better person than you were before joining the company. Outside of monies earned from dealmaking, discretionary annual bonuses will be paid out to everyone in the firm based on performance. Commercial Bankers make 30-50% commission earned on all deals closed.
This is NOT an employment offer but full commission, nonsalaried with no caps on your income.
Title: Commercial Banker
Reports to: VP of Markets
Compensation: Commission Only
Overview:
As a commercial banker at our loan brokering investment bank, you will be responsible for sourcing and securing finance for clients. You will work with clients to assess their financial needs and goals, and use your expertise and relationships with lenders to secure the most favorable financing terms for them. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying and targeting potential clients, as well as building and maintaining relationships with existing clients. You will also be responsible for analyzing market trends and identifying new opportunities for the company to pursue.
Key Responsibilities:
Identify and target potential clients who could benefit from the company's finance brokering services. This may involve conducting market research, analyzing data, and building relationships with potential clients.
Sourcing finance for clients and working with them to determine the most appropriate financing options for their needs. This may include reviewing financial statements, preparing loan packages, and negotiating terms with lenders.
Building and maintaining strong relationships with clients, including conducting regular client meetings and presentations. You will be the primary point of contact for clients and will be responsible for ensuring that their needs are met and their expectations are exceeded.
Analyzing market trends and identifying new opportunities for the company to pursue. You will be expected to keep abreast of industry developments and to identify potential growth areas for the company.
Participating in business development activities, including networking events and industry conferences. You will be expected to actively seek out new business opportunities and to represent the company in a professional manner.
Collaborating with other departments within the company, including the underwriting and closing teams, to ensure a smooth and efficient loan process for clients. You will be expected to work closely with these teams to ensure that deals are closed in a timely manner.
Requirements:
Strong analytical skills and ability to assess financial risks and opportunities. You should be comfortable working with financial data and be able to identify key trends and patterns.
Excellent communication and presentation skills. You should be able to clearly and effectively communicate complex financial concepts to clients and stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team. You should be able to take ownership of your work and be able to work effectively with others to achieve common goals.
Strong business development skills and ability to build and maintain relationships with clients. You should be able to identify and pursue new business opportunities and be able to build and maintain strong relationships with clients.
Experience working with a variety of financing products, including term loans, revolving credit facilities, and structured finance.
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced commercial banker to join our team. If you are passionate about finance and have a track record of success in the industry, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity. This is a commission only position with potential for unlimited earning potential.
In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with a wide range of clients and to make a significant impact on the growth and success of the company. If you are driven, ambitious, and have a track record of success in the finance industry, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity.

Title: Financial Services Representative
Job Description:
We are looking to hire a detail-oriented financial services representative to persuade clients to purchase our financial products and services. The financial services representative’s responsibilities include responding to clients' inquiries in a professional manner, providing sound financial advice to clients, cross-selling our products and services where possible, and attending various training programs as required. To be successful as a financial services representative, you should be able to build rapport with clients and continually meet or exceed sales goals. Developing and sustaining long-term relationships with clients to encourage repeat business and client referrals.
Cold-calling potential clients to inform them of the various financial products and services on offer.
Suggesting viable solutions to improve clients' financial statuses.
Developing in-depth knowledge of our financial products to advise clients accordingly.

Proven experience working as a financial services representative.
Sound knowledge of financial legislation.
Proficiency in all Microsoft Office applications.
Strong mathematical skills.
Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
Effective communication skills.
Exceptional customer service skills.

Title: Head of Banking & Financial Services Industry
Job Description:
Overview:
At UiPath we see boundless potential in the way we live. It drives the way we work. Our culture is our most valuable asset, that's why it acts like a compass to us. We're fast, immersed, humble and bold. And that's not just words on the walls.
Eliminating time-consuming tasks means people get to do more of what they love. It's an inspiring, high stakes challenge that motivates us, and this common passion bonds UiPath employees globally. We all strive every day to be better and to accelerate human achievement.
We make robots, but we hire people. Would you like to be part of this journey?

The Banking & Financial Services Industry Leader will lead a team of global industry subject matter experts (SME) in support of business development and sales growth. This role is critical to helping our clients adopt an automation mindset as they work to build scale and Intelligent Automation across the enterprise. The candidate should have deep understanding and proven success with industry sales, executing business development models and experience driving global sales growth. This role will be accountable for delivering industry performance, growth, and integration with UiPath sales, marketing, and product engineering teams.
What you'll do at UiPath:
Design, deliver, and execute a global strategy for industry sales, pipeline and mindshare growth.
Develop and implement regional industry channel model that enables the global sales business.
Collaborate with UiPath sales, product and customer success teams for value-based selling and help build re-useable assets and artifacts that can be used across automation programs from selling and delivery perspective.
Lead thought leadership through whitepapers, point of view content, proof of concepts, demos and industry best practices.
Explore new technical and business tools, especially UiPath’s technology partners as part of solution design for industries.
What you'll bring to the team:
B.A. or equivalent advanced degree
Industry Expert – 10-15 years of relevant work experience with exposure to sales, business development, advisory, and/or consulting roles.
Experience leading a group of SME’s and supporting industry growth models.
Experience owning a sales P&L and having quota accountability.
Experience with the following competencies: Automation Strategy, Functional Architecture, and/or System Integration.
Excellent business understanding of industry functions to help transform business operations.
Great public presence in support of customer facing and digital events.
Should be able to engage with CxOs and RPA COE heads to convince on solutions and product offerings, drive strategy/transformation work, and manage implementation programs.
Thought leadership/Innovation to conceptualize and drive new solution/product offerings and take them to market.
Ability to travel as appropriate.
:
